2018å¹´æ›´æ–°ç‰ˆ

2018æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç‰¹æ®Šçš„å¹´ä»½ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ç”Ÿä¿¡æŠ€èƒ½æ ‘è½åœ°äº†å¾ˆå¤šçº¿ä¸‹åˆ†äº«ä¼šï¼Œä½œä¸ºåˆ›å§‹äººæˆ‘èº«å…ˆå£«å’å‡†å¤‡äº†éå¸¸å¤šçš„å¹²è´§æ•™ç¨‹ï¼Œåœ¨Bç«™å…è´¹åˆ†äº« 74å°æ—¶çš„ç”Ÿç‰©ä¿¡æ¯å­¦ç³»åˆ—è§†é¢‘è¯¾ç¨‹ï¼š 1.3ä¸ªå­¦ç”Ÿçš„linuxè§†é¢‘å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®°

æœ¬é¡¹ç›®ä¸»è¦æ˜¯GEOæ•°æ®åº“æŒ–æ˜è¯¾ç¨‹çš„ä»£ç ä»“åº“ï¼Œè®°ä½ï¼Œä¸‹é¢çš„æ¯ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹éƒ½å€¼å¾—ä½ æ‹¿å‡º50ä¸ªå°æ—¶ä»¥ä¸Šçš„æ—¶é—´æ¥å­¦ä¹ ã€‚

ä»“åº“æ¦‚æ‹¬

ä¸»è¦é¡¹ç›®ä»£ç æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ï¼š

  • GSE42872_mainï¼Œä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºGEOæ•°æ®åº“æŒ–æ˜çš„æ ‡å‡†6æ­¥éª¤
  • GSE11121_surivivalï¼Œä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºåŸºäºåŸºå› è¡¨è¾¾é‡åˆ†ç»„çš„æ‰¹é‡ç”Ÿå­˜åˆ†æ

å…­ä¸ªä»»åŠ¡é¡¹ç›®æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ï¼š

  • task1-check-specific-genes ï¼Œ ä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºæ£€æŸ¥è‡ªå·±æ„Ÿå…´è¶£çš„åŸºå› åœ¨å¤šä¸ªGSEæ•°æ®é›†è¡¨ç°æƒ…å†µ

  • task2-lncRNA-mRNA-network ï¼Œ ä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºå¦‚ä½•æ„å»ºç½‘ç»œ

  • task3-multiple-groups ï¼Œ ä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºï¼Œå¦‚æœæ ·æœ¬åˆ†ç»„ä¿¡æ¯éå¸¸å¤æ‚è¯¥å¦‚ä½•è¿›è¡Œä¸‹æ¸¸åˆ†æ

  • task4-NPCï¼Œ ä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºGEOæ•°æ®åº“æŒ–æ˜çš„æ ‡å‡†6æ­¥éª¤ï¼Œè·ŸGSE42872_mainç±»ä¼¼

  • task5-dynamic-network-biomarkerï¼Œä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºæ–°çš„ç®—æ³•ï¼Œè¶…è„±äºGSE42872_mainå±•ç¤ºçš„GEOæ•°æ®åº“æŒ–æ˜çš„æ ‡å‡†6æ­¥éª¤

  • task6-GEO-TCGAï¼Œä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºå¦‚ä½•ç»“åˆTCGAæ•°æ®åº“

ä¸¤ä¸ªé¢å¤–è¡¥å……é¡¹ç›®æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ï¼š

  • airway_RNAseqï¼Œä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºå¦‚æœæ˜¯RNA-seqå¾—åˆ°çš„è¡¨è¾¾çŸ©é˜µè¯¥å¦‚ä½•åˆ†æï¼Œä¸ä¼ ç»ŸèŠ¯ç‰‡è¡¨è¾¾çŸ©é˜µçš„å¼‚åŒ
  • breast_cancer_meta-analysis ï¼Œ ä¸»è¦æ¼”ç¤ºå¦‚ä½•è¿›è¡Œmetaåˆ†æã€‚

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸»è¦ä»£ç æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ GSE42872_main ä»£ç çš„å±•ç¤ºï¼š

Then run step1 : download data

æ•°æ®æ˜¯çµé­‚ï¼

It always not very easy to download data if you are in China, so I also upload the file GSE42872_raw_exprSet.Rdata , you can load it directly.

if(F){
  library(GEOquery)
  gset <- getGEO('GSE42872', destdir=".",
                 AnnotGPL = F,
                 getGPL = F)
  save(gset,'GSE42872.gset.Rdata')
}
load('GSE42872_eSet.Rdata')
b = eSet[[1]] # çœ‹æ¸…æ¥šï¼ŒæŸäº›GSEæ•°æ®é›†æœ‰å¤šä¸ªå¹³å°ï¼Œæ³¨æ„æŒ‘é€‰
raw_exprSet=exprs(b) 
group_list=c(rep('control',3),rep('case',3))
save(raw_exprSet,group_list,
     file='GSE42872_raw_exprSet.Rdata')

Then step2: check the expression matrix

é«˜è´¨é‡çš„æ•°æ®æ˜¯ä¿éšœï¼

Try to understand my codes, how did I filter the probes by the annotation of each microarry, and how I check the group information for the different samples in each experiment.

Including PCA and Cluster figures, as below:

Please ensure that you do run those codes by yourself !!!

Then step3: do DEG analysis

å·®å¼‚åˆ†ææ˜¯æ ¸å¿ƒæµç¨‹

Normally we will do differential expression analysis for the microarray, and LIMMA is one of the best method, so I just use it. If the expression matrix(raw counts ) comes from mRNA-seq, you can also choose DESeq based on negative binomial (NB) distributions or baySeq and EBSeq.

Once DEG finished, we can choose top N genes for heatmap as below:

and volcano plot as below:

Then step4 : annotation for GO and KEGG database

æ•°æ®åº“çš„æ³¨é‡Šæ˜¯å‡åï¼

Annotation for the significantly changed genes, over-representation test or GSEA for GO/KEGG/biocarta/rectome/MsigDB and so on.

Step5: survival analysis

ç”Ÿå­˜åˆ†ææ˜¯è¡¥å……ï¼Œåªæœ‰æ ·æœ¬é‡è¶³å¤Ÿï¼Œè€Œä¸”æ ·æœ¬çš„ä¸´åºŠä¿¡æ¯è¶³å¤Ÿæ‰èƒ½åšè¿™æ ·çš„åˆ†æã€‚

KM and cox ï¼Œéœ€è¦æŒæ¡ç»Ÿè®¡å­¦åŸç†ã€‚

Step6: GSEA for Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB)

ç®—æ³•æ˜¯äº®ç‚¹ï¼Œä»£ç è§æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹

Step7: GSVA for Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB)

ç®—æ³•æ˜¯é—¨æ§›ï¼Œä»£ç è§æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹

æ›´å¤šå…¶å®ƒä¾‹å­

ä¸ä¸€ä¸€ä»‹ç»ï¼Œè¯·è‡³å°‘èŠ±è´¹å‡ åä¸ªå°æ—¶å­¦ä¹ è¿™äº›ä»£ç ï¼š

The videos tutorials :

All the videos are uploaded in YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC67sImqK7V8tSWHMG8azIVA/videos

ç•ªå¤–

ä¸»è¦æ˜¯æ ¹æ®å¤§å®¶çš„éœ€æ±‚å•¦ï¼Œå¸Œæœ›å¤§å®¶å¤šå¤šåé¦ˆå’Œæé—®å“ˆï¼

æœ€é‡è¦çš„æ˜¯ï¼š

å¦‚æœä½ è§‰å¾—æˆ‘çš„æ•™ç¨‹å¯¹ä½ æœ‰å¸®åŠ©ï¼Œè¯·èµèµä¸€æ¯å’–å•¡å“¦ï¼

entry.title: andrewheiss/bayesf22.classes.andrewheiss.com
entry.summary:
ğŸ“Š ğŸŒ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ« Website for PhD-level independent readings course on Bayesian statistics with R and Stan, built with Quarto

Bayesian Statistics Readings

Andrew Heiss and Meng Ye
PMAP 8911 â€¢ Fall 2022
Andrew Young School of Policy Studies â€¢ Georgia State University

How to build the site

  1. Install RStudio version 2022.07.1 or later since it has a Quarto installation embedded in it. Otherwise, download and install Quarto separately.
  2. Open bayesf22.Rproj to open an RStudio Project.
  3. If itâ€™s not installed already, R should try to install the {renv} package when you open the RStudio Project for the first time. If you donâ€™t see a message about package installation, install it yourself by running install.packages("renv") in the R console.
  4. Run renv::restore() in the R console to install all the required packages for this project.
  5. Run targets::tar_make() in the R console to build everything.
  6. ğŸ‰ All done! ğŸ‰ The complete website will be in a folder named _site/.

{targets} pipeline

We use the {targets} package to build this site and all its supporting files. The complete pipeline is defined in _targets.R and can be run in the R console with:

targets::tar_make()

The pipeline does a few major tasks:

  • Run long-running Bayesian scripts: Bayesian computation with MCMC sampling takes a long time. Instead of running our models in .qmd files that are re-run when rendering the website, we run them in separate .R files (located in R/) and show their results in their corresponding .qmd files.

  • Build Quarto website: This project is a Quarto website, which compiles and stitches together all the .qmd files in this project based on the settings in _quarto.yml. See the Quarto website documentation for more details.

The complete pipeline looks like this:

(This uses mermaid.js syntax and should display as a graph on GitHub. You can also view it by pasting the code into https://mermaid.live.)

graph LR
  subgraph Graph
    xea717cf4a37d25dd(["bayesian_triptych"]):::skipped --> x7aa56383a054e8ba(["site"]):::queued
    xf38d3f5e6365ad72(["workflow_graph"]):::started --> x6e52cb0f1668cc22(["readme"]):::queued
  end

Licenses

Text and figures: All prose and images are licensed under Creative Commons (CC-BY-NC 4.0)

Code: All code is licensed under the MIT License.

entry.title: EmilHvitfeldt/ISLR-tidymodels-labs
entry.summary:
This book aims to be a complement to the 1st version An Introduction to Statistical Learning book with translations of the labs into using the tidymodels set of packages.

The labs will be mirrored quite closely to stay as true to the original material.
